titleproper.value: Guide to the Alvin Warren Photograph Collection <num>ALBA.PHOTO.128</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Johanna M. Blokker and Gail Malmgreen

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-07-19T18:16:38</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: Alvin R. Warren, born in 1913, joined the Abraham Lincoln Brigade soon after the outbreak of the Spanish Civil War in 1936. In time he rose to the rank of lieutenant, and was eventually made Quartermaster of a training base in Spain. The Alvin Warren Photograph Collection consists of images taken by Warren in Spain, and includes individual and group portraits of soldiers, scenes of front-line combat and behind-the-lines relaxation, war damage in the cities of Madrid, Barcelona, Quinto and Teruel, and daily life among the Spanish people.

p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment, tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library <lb/>70 Washington Square South <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

Warren remained a member of the Communist Party to the end of his life. "I am convinced that Socialism is the wave of the future," he is quoted as saying; "[T]he Communist party is the only party that has the ideology, ability and background experience to lead this movement through."

The Alvin Warren Photograph Collection consists of photographs taken by Warren during his years as a volunteer fighting in Spain; although most are undated, they can be assumed to date from the period 1936 to 1938. The collection contains 22 photographic prints depicting individual soldiers and groups of soldiers, scenes of front-line combat and activity behind the lines, street scenes and views of Madrid, Barcelona, Quinto and Teruel, and daily life among the Spanish people.

corpname.value: Spain. Ejercito Popular de la Republica. Abraham Lincoln Battalion
